title: What are the benefits of a comment section on a website? - Quora

response.answer_text: Comment sections are a great opportunity for you to foster a personal relationship with your users. Digitally savvy users that are interacting with your content are now doing so from mobile devices more than half of the time. And mobile users love the sense of participation. If you can engage your user on a personal level and not only welcome comments/reviews but encourage them, it will do three things. it shows you have nothing to hide and are welcoming the healthy scrutiny of your users - you want to know their opinions and how you can improve your business to better serve their needs.give you some actual points of reference in terms of measuring engagement. This is a tough metric to really nail down - but the best indicators of high engagement are heatmaps, read time, shares, and comments.bring your user into the conversation. Like I said, we love participation. The more you can associate their memory of your brand with action more than just an idea the stronger their association with your brand will be.Basically, having a comment section is almost always worth it unless you don’t have the time to maintain it properly or - worse - you do have the time and lose your professionalism in a comment war with one displeased user. Here’s a hint: both sides of comment wars are losers, every time.

I think the most important benefits of a comments section, which a lot of other people seemed to miss, was the SEO boost offered by a comments section. Adding a comments section on your blog posts greatly increases your SEO score on your posts, particularly ones that are shorter. [1] This means that more people will find your content, and more people will comment. As well as this, as already mentioned by others, it increases the interactivity on your site and makes users more likely to return knowing they can have an input. Footnotes[1] What A Blogger Should Know About Blog Comments Relation With SEO
